Checks if image paths in a DataFrame column exist.

  • image_path_column (str) – Name of the column containing image paths.

image_channel_analysis.py¶

Image channel analysis and mask extraction utilities.

Module-level functions for image channel analysis and mask extraction. All functions are at the module level for Sphinx compatibility and batch workflows.

image_path – Path to the image file.

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_channel_analysis.format_data_to_dataframe(data)¶

Converts a specific data structure (list of tuples with nested region data and numpy arrays) into a pandas DataFrame with column headers representing the step, region, and percentile, and numerical values all in a single row.

Parameters:

data –

A list of tuples. Each tuple contains: - An integer representing the step (e.g., 60, 120). - A list of tuples. Each inner tuple contains:

  • An integer representing the region ID (e.g., 1, 2).

  • A numpy array of four floats representing the 25th, 50th, 75th, and 95th percentiles.

Returns:

A DataFrame with columns like ‘Step_X_Region_Y_25th’, ‘Step_X_Region_Y_50th’, etc., and numerical values in a single row.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_channel_analysis.gradient_analysis(image_path, verbose=False, vis=False)¶

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.absolute_scale_difference(df)¶

Calculates the absolute difference between the maximum and minimum values for each numerical column in a pandas DataFrame. :param df: The input DataFrame. :type df: pd.DataFrame

Returns:

A Series where the index is the column name and the values

are the absolute difference between the maximum and minimum values for that column. Only numerical columns are included.

Return type:

pd.Series

Returns:

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.explain_tSne(X, X_embedded, verbose=False)¶
czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.get_umap_feature_importance(original_df: DataFrame, umap_embedding: ndarray, feature_columns: list, test_size: float = 0.2, random_state: int = 42, n_top_features: int = 10) → dict¶

Calculates the feature importance of original features in predicting UMAP embedding dimensions using a Random Forest Regressor.

Ensures that UMAP coordinates themselves are NOT used as features for prediction.

Parameters:

  • original_df (pd.DataFrame) – The original DataFrame containing all features.

  • umap_embedding (np.ndarray) – The 2D (or 3D) UMAP embedding coordinates. Shape should be (n_samples, n_components).

  • feature_columns (list) – A list of strings, containing the names of the original columns in original_df that were used to generate the UMAP embedding. These will be used as predictors for the Random Forest.

  • test_size (float) – The proportion of the dataset to include in the test split.

  • random_state (int) – Controls the randomness of the data splitting and Random Forest.

  • n_top_features (int) – The number of top features to display for each UMAP dimension.

Returns:

A dictionary containing pandas Series of feature importances for each UMAP dimension (e.g., ‘UMAP1_importance’, ‘UMAP2_importance’).

Return type:

dict

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.group_and_pivot_mean(df)¶

Group data by ‘person-ID’ and ‘type’, calculate the mean of numerical columns, and pivot the table to create a wide-format DataFrame. :param df: Input DataFrame. :type df: pd.DataFrame

Returns:

Pivoted DataFrame with aggregated values.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Returns:

Pivoted DataFrame with aggregated values.

Return type:

Perform HDBSCAN clustering on UMAP embedding. :param umap_embedding: UMAP embedding of the data. :type umap_embedding: np.ndarray :param min_cluster_size: Minimum size of clusters (default: 5). :type min_cluster_size: int :param min_samples: Minimum samples in a cluster (default: None). :type min_samples: int or None

Returns:

Cluster labels for each data point.

Return type:

np.ndarray

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.pca_analysis(df, features, n_components=2)¶

Perform PCA on the selected features. :param df: Input DataFrame. :type df: pd.DataFrame :param features: List of features to use for PCA. :type features: list :param n_components: Number of principal components to keep (default: 2). :type n_components: int

Returns:

DataFrame with PCA results.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.pca_visualization(pca_df, path_4_png, input_type)¶

Visualize the PCA results by plotting the first two principal components. :param pca_df: DataFrame with PCA results (should contain ‘source’ column). :type pca_df: pd.DataFrame :param path_4_png: Path to save the plot. :type path_4_png: str :param input_type: Input type for the plot title. :type input_type: str

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.plot_umap_embedding(umap_embedding, clusters, source, path_4_png, input_type)¶

Plots the UMAP embedding colored by clusters and uses symbols for sources. :param umap_embedding: The 2D UMAP embedding coordinates. :type umap_embedding: np.ndarray :param clusters: 1D array of cluster labels for each data point. :type clusters: np.ndarray :param source: Pandas Series containing source labels for each data point. :type source: pd.Series :param path_4_png: Path to save the plot. :type path_4_png: str :param input_type: Input type for the plot title. :type input_type: str

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.run_feature_analysis()¶

Main function to execute the feature analysis pipeline. It performs the following steps: 1. Load the dataset. 2. Assign new columns based on the ‘image_name’ column. 3. Group and pivot the data. 4. Drop specific columns based on substrings. 5. Perform correlation analysis to select unique features. 6. Apply t-SNE, UMAP, and PCA for dimensionality reduction and visualization. Note: File paths and input types are hardcoded for this example.

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.tsne_clustering(df, features, path_4_png, input_type, n_components=2, random_state=42, perplexity=30, n_iter=1000)¶

Perform t-SNE clustering on the selected features and plot the results. :param df: Input DataFrame. :type df: pd.DataFrame :param features: List of features to use for clustering. :type features: list :param path_4_png: Path to save the plot. :type path_4_png: str :param input_type: Input type for the plot title. :type input_type: str :param n_components: Number of dimensions for t-SNE (default: 2). :type n_components: int :param random_state: Random seed for reproducibility (default: 42). :type random_state: int :param perplexity: Perplexity parameter for t-SNE (default: 30). :type perplexity: int :param n_iter: Number of iterations for optimization (default: 1000). :type n_iter: int

Returns:

t-SNE embedding of the data.

Return type:

np.ndarray

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.umap_clustering(df, features, path_4_png, input_type, n_neighbors=35, min_dist=0.15, random_state=42)¶

Perform UMAP clustering on the selected features and plot the results. :param df: Input DataFrame. :type df: pd.DataFrame :param features: List of features to use for clustering. :type features: list :param path_4_png: Path to save the plot. :type path_4_png: str :param input_type: Input type for the plot title. :type input_type: str :param n_neighbors: Number of neighbors for UMAP (default: 35). :type n_neighbors: int :param min_dist: Minimum distance parameter for UMAP (default: 0.15). :type min_dist: float :param random_state: Random seed for reproducibility (default: 42). :type random_state: int

Returns:

UMAP embedding of the data.

Return type:

np.ndarray

czbi_da_parez.analysis.feature_analysis.variance_analysis(df, most_unique_features, path_4_png, input_type)¶

Perform variance analysis and visualize the projection of data colored by source. :param df: DataFrame containing the data to analyze. :type df: pd.DataFrame :param most_unique_features: List of the most unique features for analysis. :type most_unique_features: list :param path_4_png: Path to save the plot. :type path_4_png: str :param input_type: Input type for the plot title. :type input_type: str

Convert a Jupyter Notebook (.ipynb) file to a Python (.py) script.
